title: What if all the presidents met each other? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I think it would be like lunch at a high school cafeteria. You’d have Washington, Lincoln, the Roosevelts, and maybe Obama hanging out together, with humorous and cringe worthy comments like how they’re amazed ‘the negro’ finally got the position. Then you’d have the beta cool group. Reagan, Eisenhower, Kennedy, Wilson, and Grant all hanging out talking about how great things were and how things have gone off the rails. Clinton would probably be there lamenting that no women have gotten elected president yet. Then the ‘too cool’ group: Jefferson, Adams, Madison, LBJ and Jackson. They’d be REALLY critical about life today. There’d be the ‘ehhh’ group of misfits. Middle stringers. Truman. The Bushes. Polk. Ford. They mostly just talk shop. Then you’d have the ones that don’t socialize well. Nixon. I think Carter would keep him company, because he’s such a nice guy. Coolidge. Then you;d have the ‘bad presidents’ group. Taft wondering where Warren is. Hoover muttering that the depression would have worked itself out. Johnson lamenting almost getting kicked out by one vote. James Buchanan just fuming. Then the door slams open and in walks Trump, marching right up to Washington and company. “This is yuge. This is so yuge! I’m such a yuge fan!” Utter and complete silence. Obama just covers his face and pretends this makes Trump go away as Washington stares with a face of ‘Good god, what is this orange thing in our company?’. And from the back of the room, we hear James Buchanan cry out, “Whooo hooo! I’m not the worst!”
Any answer is pure speculation and thus, meaningless.
